Q: My test and production servers are behind corporate firewalls. Which IP addresses do I need to whitelist to communicate with 6RS?
A: 6RS northbound messages are routed through 4 IP addresses in both test and production environments: 35.224.245.180, 35.192.177.203, 35.232.243.155, 35.232.247.34

Q: What are the message formats that you support?
What are the different transport protocol supported by you?
How does chuck integrate to your cloud to get work?
A: Chuck requests work from our cloud services via HTTPS

Q: We do not allow direct access to our end points. Do you support VPN?
A: Yes. We would work with your IT security team to set that up

Q: How much data do your chucks use?
A: Around 200 MB/chuck/per day with full logging turned on. If bandwidth is a problem we can turn logging down to limit the data usage

Q: Can I assign static IPs to chucks?
A: No. We can only accept IPs via DHCP

Q: Our warehouse has spotty connection, can chucks still work?
A: Yes. but we would need internet at some key locations defined by our solutions/deployment team
